eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Checkbox
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Checkbox that can be toggled by a left-click or touch.
description: When the checkbox is checked, the condition `Checked` is verified.
A halo appears when the mouse hovers near the checkbox.
Checkbox cannot be toggled by users if any of these are true:
- Checkbox is hidden
- Checkbox's layer is hidden
- Checkbox is disabled
Checkbox can always be changed by an action.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description:
Checkbox can be toggled by a left-click or touch. 

When the checkbox is checked, the condition `Checked` is TRUE.
A halo appears when the mouse hovers near the checkbox.

Checkbox cannot be toggled by users if any of these are true:
- Checkbox is hidden
- Checkbox's layer is hidden
- Checkbox is disabled

Checkbox can always be changed by an action.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: Checkbox

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/), D8H
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: DraggableSliderControl
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: A draggable slider that users can move to select a numerical value.
description: Draws a draggable slider that users can move to select a numerical value.
The value range, tick spacing, and the appearance of the slider can be defined with properties.
How to use:
- Add this behavior a **Shape Painter** object
- Place an instance of that shape painter on the screen where you want the slider to appear
- Use the "Value" expression to find the Value based on the position of the slider
Tips:
- You can disable the slider to prevent a user from interacting with it
- You can set the Value of the slider and the slider will move to the correct position
Further details can be found in [this tutorial video](https://youtu.be/iiTUwdAT_hs).
Breaking changes (1.0.0)
- Track thickness and length properties replaced track width and height. These 2 properties must be set again if they were different from the default size.
- Hidden sliders can be dragged. The "enable" action must be used to disable them.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Let users select a numerical value by dragging a slider.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: DraggableSliderControl

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Add00, AlanPH, Tristan (Victris Games)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ColorConversion
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Expressions to convert RGB color values into various other colour formats (HSV, HSL, named colors) and vice versa.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description: Expressions to convert RGB color values into various other colour formats (HSV, HSL, named colors) and vice versa.

eventsFunctions.description: Converts a hexadecimal string into a RGB string.  Example input: "0459AF"
eventsFunctions.name: HexToRgb

inlineCode: if (v.toString(16) === n.toUpperCase()) throw 'input is not hexadecimal';
n = n.replace(shorthandRegex, function (m, r, g, b) {
return r + r + g + g + b + b;
console.error("Unable to convert a color: ", e);

eventsFunctions.description: Converts a RGB string into a hexadecimal string.  Example input: "0;128;255"
eventsFunctions.name: RgbToHex

inlineCode: console.error("Unable to convert a color: ", e);

eventsFunctions.description: Converts a RGB string into a HSL string.  Example input: "0;128;255""
eventsFunctions.name: RgbToHsl

inlineCode: let v = Math.max(r, g, b), c = v - Math.min(r, g, b), f = (1 - Math.abs(v + v - c - 1));
eventsFunctionContext.returnValue = Math.round(60 * (h < 0 ? h + 6: h)) + ';' + Math.round((f ? c / f: 0) * 100) + ';' + Math.round(((v + v - c) / 2) * 100);

eventsFunctions.description: Converts HSV color values into a RGB string.  Valid input ranges:  H(0 to 360), S(0 to 100), V(0 to 100)
eventsFunctions.name: HsvToRgb

inlineCode: let f = (n , k = (n + h / 60) % 6) => v - v * s * Math.max(Math.min(k, 4 - k, 1), 0);
console.error("Unable to convert a color: ", e);

eventsFunctions.description: Converts a RGB string into a HSV string.  Example input: "0;128;255"
eventsFunctions.name: RgbToHsv

inlineCode: eventsFunctionContext.returnValue = Math.round(60 * (h < 0 ? h + 6: h)) + ';' + Math.round((v && c / v) * 100) + ';' + Math.round(v * 100);
console.error("Unable to convert a color: ", e);

eventsFunctions.description:
Converts a color name into a RGB string.  (Examples: black, gray, white, red, purple, green, yellow, blue)  
Full list of colors: https://www.w3schools.com/colors/colors_names.asp
eventsFunctions.name: NameToRgb

eventsFunctions.description: Converts HSL color values into a RGB string.  Valid input ranges:  H(0 to 360), S(0 to 100), L(0 to 100)
eventsFunctions.name: HslToRgb

inlineCode: let f = (n, k = (n + h / 30) % 12) => l - a * Math.max(Math.min(k - 3, 9 - k , 1), - 1);
console.error("Unable to convert a color: ", e);

eventsFunctions.description: Converts a color hue (range: 0 to 360) into an RGB color string with 100% saturation and 50% lightness.
eventsFunctions.name: HueToRgb

inlineCode: let f = (n, k = (n + h / 30) % 12) => l - a * Math.max(Math.min(k - 3, 9 - k , 1), - 1);
console.error("Unable to convert a color: ", e);

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: 4ian
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Parallax
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Behaviors to animate Tiled Sprite objects in the background, following the camera with a parallax effect.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description: Behaviors to animate Tiled Sprite objects in the background, following the camera with a parallax effect.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Move the image of a Tiled Sprite to follow the camera horizontally with a parallax effect. After adding this to an object, put the object on a layer that is not moving, behind the layer that is followed (for example, a layer called "Background").
eventsBasedBehaviors.fullName: Horizontal Parallax for a Tiled Sprite
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: HorizontalTiledSpriteParallax

propertyDescriptors.label: Parallax factor (speed for the parallax, usually between 0 and 1)
propertyDescriptors.name: ParallaxFactor

propertyDescriptors.label: Layer to be followed (leave empty for the base layer)
propertyDescriptors.name: FollowedLayer

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Move the image of a Tiled Sprite to follow the camera vertically with a parallax effect. After adding this to an object, put the object on a layer that is not moving, behind the layer that is followed (for example, a layer called "Background").
eventsBasedBehaviors.fullName: Vertical Parallax for a Tiled Sprite
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: VerticalTiledSpriteParallax

propertyDescriptors.label: Parallax factor (speed for the parallax, usually between 0 and 1)
propertyDescriptors.name: ParallaxFactor

propertyDescriptors.label: Layer to be followed (leave empty for the base layer)
propertyDescriptors.name: FollowedLayer

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Tristan Rhodes (tristan@victrisgames.com)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.fullName: Make object travel to random positions
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: TravelToRandomPositions
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Make object travel to random positions (with the pathfinding behavior).
description: When the action is used, the object(s) will select a random nearby location and begin moving towards it (using the Pathfinding behavior).

If desired, choose a direction and how closely you want the object to follow it.  This can be used to make objects chase (or run away from) the player, or to make objects cross the screen using a meandering path.
If you keep using the action, once the object reaches a destination, it will select a new random location and begin moving towards it.
If you want to modify the speed of the object, edit the Pathfinding behavior of the object.

eventsFunctions.description: Make object travel to a random position around the object current position. The movement is initiated only when the object is not moving already (its Pathfinding behavior speed is 0).  Move towards a specified angle, if desired.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Make object travel to a random position, with optional direction
eventsFunctions.name: TravelToRandomPositions
eventsFunctions.sentence: Move _PARAM1_ to random positions, where each stop is at least _PARAM3_px and at most _PARAM4_px from the current position. Move towards angle _PARAM5_ with a biais of _PARAM6_.

events.comment: Only run when the object is not being moved by Pathfinding
Use default values if needed
Calculate the distance the object will travel
Calculate the maximum difference in degrees allowed from "Direction" based on "DirectionBias"
Select a random direction within the range
Select a direction based on the offset
Calculate position based on direction and distance
Create a new destination every time the object stops

parameters.description: Object that will be travelling (must have Pathfinding behavior)
parameters.name: Object

parameters.description: Direction (in degrees) the object will move towards (Range: 0-360)
parameters.name: Direction

parameters.longDescription: For example: "0" picks a completely random direction, "0.5" will select a direction within the half-circle that faces the specified direction, and "1" simply uses the specified direction.
parameters.name: DirectionBias

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Jeroen Erkens, Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: FollowObjectsWithCamera
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Change the zoom and position of the camera to keep all instances of an object (or object group) on the screen.
description: Use the "Follow multiple objects with camera" action on every frame that you want the camera to move.
If you want to select which object instances are tracked by the camera, add conditions to that event.
- Use an object group to track multiple objects.
- Only run on one layer at a time.  If multiple layers need to move the same way, create events that copy CameraX, CameraY, and CameraZoom values (or use the "Copy camera settings" extension)
- This action can also be used on a single object instance to move the camera smoothly.
Release Notes:

- Version 1.0.0 removed the "MinZoom", "Layer", and "Camera" parameters. Layer is now selected automatically from one of the objects being followed. Events that were created with previous versions of this extension will continue working.

eventsFunctions.description: Change the zoom and position of the camera to keep all instances of an object (or object group) on the screen.
eventsFunctions.name: FollowMultipleObjectsWithCamera
eventsFunctions.sentence: Move camera to keep instances of _PARAM1_ on the screen. Use a margin of _PARAM2_px horizontally and _PARAM3_px vertically. Max zoom: _PARAM4_.  Move the camera at a speed of _PARAM5_

events.comment: Set default values if nothing is entered
Set initial values based on an object instance.  This is used as a valid starting point for comparisons, so it doesn't matter which instance is used.

Loop through every instance of object (or object group) and determine the max position values used for left, right, top and bottom.
Record the height and width of the objects that are on the edges.  These values will be used to increase the camera viewport to include the entire object.
Move camera to the center location
Zoom in or out to keep all object instances on screen
Adjust zoom to stay within min/max values
Change camera zoom
